description: Office 365 is a cloud based productivity suite for individuals, companies and even government agencies.  It is designed to deliver software as service to any and every user regardless of location. The Office 365 solution is designed to relieve the technical challenge of software management and delivery, regardless of location from the local IT personnel.  This allows the IT professional to focus in implementing, deploying and operating Office 365 services and administrating supporting technologies, like email, collaboration and storage.  If youâ€™re an IT professional who takes part in evaluating, planning, deploying, and operating the Office 365 services, including its dependencies, requirements, and supporting technologies this series will demonstrate and help you to see what is involved in setting up Office 365 for your organization.
name: Microsoft Office 365 - 70-346
subtitle: Managing Office 365 Identities and Requirements

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:08.542
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:08.542 --> 00:00:13.220
Hello, in this series of videos,
Ronnie and I are gonna be covering

3
00:00:13.220 --> 00:00:18.990
the 70-346 exam Managing Office
365 Identities and Requirements.

4

Here to tell us a little bit more about
what we can expect out of these videos

5
00:00:22.500 --> 00:00:24.480
Here's the one and only Ronnie Wong.

6
00:00:24.480 --> 00:00:26.440
>> Well thank you Mike
as we continue on and

7
00:00:26.440 --> 00:00:30.310
taking a look at getting
certified in Office 365.

8

That's where we are beginning right?

There's an exam that covers the material
that we're actually going to be taking

10
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:41.150
a look at and that is the exam labeled
as 70-346 For what Mike was saying.

11
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:45.510
And let me show you the official

12

that way we'll be able to see

13

So here on the website itself,

14
00:00:53.680 --> 00:00:58.250
And this is part one of the MCSA, so

15

there's another series that's

But this is the first in line

Now when we take a look at this, remember

Dollars, and you will go ahead and sign

So make sure you take a look at that page.

You can do your favorite search,

If you'll just search for

Now as we take a look at this series,

there's a couple of things that

This is not an exam for beginners and this

but if you'll notice that they even tell

Let me go back to that webpage.

00:01:49.900 --> 00:01:50.900
So there it is.

There's actually gonna be familiarity with

Skype for Business Online,

in other words, their subscription As

And you wanna make sure that you do

Now what we're gonna focus in on,

So the first thing that we

just understanding how do we provision

and getting ready ready for that.

45
00:02:41.410 --> 00:02:42.740
If you haven't set it up,

we show you the basics here of
understanding how to get a tenant.

47

And then, how does that connect in with

And we show you how to configure and

49
00:02:56.140 --> 00:02:59.510
The way that they move through
office 365 is that they want you to

50

move from the very fact of

all the way into a production very

00:03:08.110 --> 00:03:10.600
As you;re actually practicing,
you're setting up for

production at the same time.

So that's what they talk about

Then we continue to move on

And we talk about making sure that you

00:03:38.180 --> 00:03:40.450
Connecting through a proxy

firewall issues that

63
00:03:43.180 --> 00:03:45.960
Then of course,
there's rights management issues.

64
00:03:45.960 --> 00:03:47.870
No longer are you just protecting data and

65

documents that are actually

66

Now that you're actually connecting
online there maybe rights management that

67

So that even if those documents leave

and we talk about the basics here too.

71

The other thing of course is understand
there's different rolls in managing office

365, we show you not only how

what those rolls actually help us to do,

74

To be able to separate out roles
such as a tenant administrator

75

versus a password administrator and
even some that are actually in between.

76
00:04:27.890 --> 00:04:29.730
And we'll take a look at
each one of those as well.

77
00:04:30.790 --> 00:04:34.210
We also of course go into
managing our identities and

78

this is about of course users.

79
00:04:36.330 --> 00:04:37.770
What happens to the user?

80
00:04:37.770 --> 00:04:41.660
As we are now actually connected not only
to the on-premise active directory, but

81

now also into our cloud service
that we have to worry about and

82
00:04:45.020 --> 00:04:48.890
how do we get those

83
00:04:48.890 --> 00:04:53.670
How do we import users into the office
365 management as we need to?

84
00:04:53.670 --> 00:04:56.470
And then of course one of the most
powerful tools that's out there

85
00:04:56.470 --> 00:04:59.120
is going to be that windows powershell for

86
00:04:59.120 --> 00:05:03.610
office 365 that will allow us to go ahead
and set up the connections that we need.

87
00:05:03.610 --> 00:05:07.220
And even managed some of
the online on Office 365.

88
00:05:07.220 --> 00:05:11.450
Of course,
then we also continue on to take a look,

89
00:05:11.450 --> 00:05:14.590
now, at what we call active
directory synchronization.

90
00:05:14.590 --> 00:05:18.480
This is when you decide that you
are now going through your pilot.

91
00:05:18.480 --> 00:05:20.880
And now you want
a synchronization to happen.

92
00:05:20.880 --> 00:05:25.430
So that when you create an account on your
on premise active directory, it now also

93
00:05:25.430 --> 00:05:29.640
appears and syncs up to, your active
directory that's actually even behind

94
00:05:29.640 --> 00:05:34.810
Microsoft, there in the Azure cloud,
as well, that's supporting Office 365.

95
00:05:34.810 --> 00:05:37.750
And we'll walk through that
step by step as well, and

96
00:05:37.750 --> 00:05:42.060
show you how to sync, synchronize

97
00:05:42.060 --> 00:05:45.350
And then, of course, we get into one of

98
00:05:45.350 --> 00:05:49.370
don't tend to implement, which is
gonna be the idea of single sign-on.

99
00:05:49.370 --> 00:05:53.910
Now that you have the actual single
sign-on, or the things in place for

100
00:05:53.910 --> 00:05:55.070
single sign-on,

101
00:05:55.070 --> 00:05:58.850
you're gonna also need to establish things
like Active Directory Federation Services,

102
00:05:58.850 --> 00:06:03.260
so that now you actually present a single
set of credentials, regardless of whether

103

you're logging on to Office 365 Or
whether you're actually logging into

104
00:06:07.250 --> 00:06:11.880
your on-premises Active Directory network,
we show you how to plan that out and

105
00:06:11.880 --> 00:06:15.150
understand the planning of
the Active Directory Federation services.

106
00:06:15.150 --> 00:06:17.130
We install the role, we configure it.

107
00:06:17.130 --> 00:06:20.795
And we even add in a proxy server if
you're gonna have users from outside your

108
00:06:20.795 --> 00:06:25.630
on-premises active directory connecting
into both of those services as well.

109
00:06:25.630 --> 00:06:26.980
And then lastly, of course, but

110
00:06:26.980 --> 00:06:32.330
not least by any comparison, we take
a look at monitoring and troubleshooting.

111
00:06:32.330 --> 00:06:36.730
These are some of the most intuitive tools
that we have in the online service for us,

112
00:06:36.730 --> 00:06:41.290
because they pack them directly into the
admin center inside of the dashboard, so

113
00:06:41.290 --> 00:06:43.160
that we can access them easily.

114
00:06:43.160 --> 00:06:46.780
That way we know if there is
actually issues going on with

115
00:06:46.780 --> 00:06:50.830
Office 365 online or is there something
I need to trouble shoot here.

116
00:06:50.830 --> 00:06:54.250
And if it's not in either place
then it's somewhere in-between.

117
00:06:54.250 --> 00:06:58.390
There are so many tools that are out there
that allows us to monitor it this stuff.

118
00:06:58.390 --> 00:07:03.500
It is very much an advantage
as an office 365

119
00:07:03.500 --> 00:07:08.100
administrator needs to know them so that
they can actually go ahead and streamline.

120
00:07:08.100 --> 00:07:11.000
What they need to do all the things
that they need to be able to manage

121
00:07:11.000 --> 00:07:12.230
both as well.

122
00:07:12.230 --> 00:07:15.210
Don't forget to take advantage of some
of the things that are also built in for

123
00:07:15.210 --> 00:07:19.280
you, since you do pay for
the Office 365 subscription at some time,

124
00:07:19.280 --> 00:07:22.310
as you are actually going to
implement this into your network.

125
00:07:22.310 --> 00:07:26.320
You also have access, of course,
to being able to open a service and

126
00:07:26.320 --> 00:07:31.720
support ticket that gives you now direct
access to Office 365 support team too.

127
00:07:31.720 --> 00:07:35.390
And the whole goal is to be able
to isolate, just like we said.

128
00:07:35.390 --> 00:07:37.120
Is it Office 365 issue?

129
00:07:37.120 --> 00:07:39.350
Is it our own issue here?

130
00:07:39.350 --> 00:07:42.820
It isolates and then that way we
can troubleshoot where we need to.

131
00:07:42.820 --> 00:07:48.910
So if you are trying to get ready for
the exam 70-346, this series

132
00:07:48.910 --> 00:07:53.460
will cover all the objectives that you
need to help you to prepare for this exam.

133
00:07:53.460 --> 00:07:55.690
Now remember that that's not
what it's limited to, and

134
00:07:55.690 --> 00:07:57.260
Microsoft never says that, right?

135
00:07:57.260 --> 00:07:59.360
They say it's actually these
that we're gonna focus in on,

136
00:07:59.360 --> 00:08:02.290
but at the same time,
they rely on your previous skill and

137
00:08:02.290 --> 00:08:05.820
knowledge with some of the tools that
are also available for you out there.

138
00:08:05.820 --> 00:08:07.730
So if you're just trying to
implement Office 365, and

139
00:08:07.730 --> 00:08:11.300
trying to get started in that for
your network, or

140
00:08:11.300 --> 00:08:14.830
if you're actually preparing for the exam,
you've come to the right place, and

141
00:08:14.830 --> 00:08:18.230
there's exciting shows for
you coming up in this series.

142
00:08:18.230 --> 00:08:22.360
So stay tuned for more.

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel help you get started with Office365 by showing you how to set up a trial Office365 account. They explain how to provision a Tenant account, configuring the name and region, as well as describing some of the common missteps to be avoided when setting up the account. Then they configure a global administrator account which will be used to manage tenant subscriptions and the licensing.
episodes.title: Provision Tenants

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explain how to connect your Office365 account to a custom domain. They begin by going over some Domain Name System(DNS) fundamentals. This includes DNS record types, hosting, and registration. Then they show you step-by-step how to get Office365 to verify and utilize your hosted DNS solution.
episodes.title: Add Custom Domain

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel introduce you to the concept of "planning a pilot" when deploying Office365. They explain what a pilot is (bascially a test environment for Office365) and then start walking you through the basic understanding of setting up a pilot; this includes checking readiness, setting up domains, adding users, and connecting email accounts.
episodes.title: Plan a Pilot

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel continue planning a pilot for testing their Office365 deployment. They begin by showing you how to setup an Office365 trial account as well as how to select appropriate users and designate them as pilot users. They also explain how you can use a program called IdFix to help discover and remediate objects that might hinder the Office365 deployment with your on premises systems.
episodes.title: Plan a Pilot Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel finish with their pilot deployment by connecting the email accounts of their pilot users to Office365. They take you step-by-step through the connection process, which includes actions like verifying domain ownership, configuring Exchange Online, updating DNS records with your DNS hosting provider, and setting up email forwarding.
episodes.title: Plan a Pilot Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel finish up their discussion on planning a pilot for Office365 deployment by explaining the test planning phase. Creating a test plan will involve making sure that your environment is prepared for integration with Office365, so Daniel and Ronnie make sure to introduce you to the fastrack tool from Microsoft which helps you determine that fact. They also discuss systems that might not require migration and finally go over aspects of all the Office365 service descriptions.
episodes.title: Plan a Pilot Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explain how to configure your clients to connect to your Office365 service. Here they discuss and demonstrate moving ownership of DNS to Office365 and creating DNS records for the services. They also show you how to work around or with a Proxy server as well as what is necessary information for firewall exceptions. Lastly they cover best practices with regards to bandwidth and internet connectivity.
episodes.title: Enable Client Connectivity

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explain how to stay secure in a boundless network environment that utilizes Office365 by employing Azure Rights Management. They begin by explaining why you might need Azure RM, following that with showing you how to active Azure RM in Office365. Next they show you how to use PowerShell to import and connect Azure RM to your Office365 account.
episodes.title: Azure Rights Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel continue looking at Azure Rights Management to add security to our Office365 environments. They pick back up by explaining how to assign users or groups as role-based administrators for Azure RM. Finally they explain how even though there are role-based administrators, there will still be times when the Rights Management Super-User may need to be utilized. They walk you through assigning that job to a user.
episodes.title: Azure Right Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel take a look at managing the different administrator roles in Office365. They begin by explaining that Office365 uses role based permissions and that is done through role-based administrators. They describe the 8 Administrator roles, Global, Billing, Password, Service, User Management, Exchange Online, Sharepoint Online, and Skype for Business Online admins. Finally they show you how to enable these roles for the necessary user(s), using both the Portal and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Office365 Admin Roles

topics.title: Plan and implement networking and security in Office 365

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explore user and password management in Office365. They cover topics like how to set a password expiration time as well as setting whether or not to enable password complexity rules. Finally they show you how to use the password reset center.
episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel continue explaining user and password management in Office365. They start by looking at user administration, specifically bulk user creation utilizing a Comma-Separated Value(CSV) file and then move to deleted account recovery. Finally they demonstrate multi-factor authentication.
episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explore managing cloud identities with PowerShell. Here they will show you how to configure non-expiring passwords, bulk user creation and updating user properties. They also cover bulk user license management and hard-deleting user accounts.
episodes.title: Manage Cloud Identities

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel discuss what preparations need to be made for connecting and synching your on-premise Active Directory environment to your Office365 cloud service. They begin by explaining reasons you would want to synchronize and then move into planing for non-routable domains. Next, they talk about some items that need to be cleaned up because they might hinder the Office365 deployment and employ some tools like IdFix and ADModify.NET to help with this process.
episodes.title: Sync to Office365

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel continue preparing for synching on-premise Active Directory servers with Office365. They pick up by explaining filtering of the Active Directory domain, Organizational Units(OUs), and Object Attributes.
episodes.title: Sync to Office 365 Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel take you through setting up the Azure Active Directory Sync(AADSync) Tool. They begin by revisiting some of the best practices and pre-planning steps that you'll need to complete as well as covering a list of prerequisites that are necessary for running AADSync; all while starting the AADSync Tool install and deployment.
episodes.title: Setup AADSync Tools

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel continue looking at the Azure Active Directory Sync(AADSync) Tool. They started the AADSync implementation in the previous episode, so here they pick right back up, starting with explaining the concept of soft match filtering, then moving on to managing AD users and finally touching upon synchronization between Office365 and Active Directory.
episodes.title: Setup AADSync Tool Part 2

topics.title: Implement and manage identities by using Azure Active Directory Synchronization (AADSync)

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes discuss planning and requirements necessary to set up a single sign on (SSO) implementation in Office 365. They look at scenarios in which a company might what to consider using an SSO. They explore federated identities, delegated users as well federated services to support single sign on.
episodes.title: Plan for Office365 SSO

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie take you step-by-step through installing and managing Active Directory Federated Services(ADFS) servers. They begin by creating an ADFS service account as well as install the Federation Services server role and supporting services like IIS and the .NET framework. They also show you how to install the necessary SSL certificate into IIS. Next they configure ADFS for Single Sign-On. Finally, they finish the setup by configuring Windows Azure Active Directory(WAAD) to connect to the Office365 environment.
episodes.title: Install ADFS for Office365

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue their explanation and demonstration of implementing and managing Federated Identities for Single Sign-On. Now that all the leg-work is done, they move into verification of service using the PowerShell and Event Viewer as well as the Office365 Portal.
episodes.title: Install ADFS for Office365 Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike begin the process of setting up an Active Directory Federation Services proxy server to provide an SSO solution from outside the organization. They discuss and demonstrate configuring the prerequisites needed to set up an ADFS proxy, including creating DNS records, installing the role, modifying the HOSTS file, and configuring the necessary certificates.
episodes.title: Install SSO Proxy Server

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike continue setting up an Active Directory Federation Services proxy server to provide an SSO solution from outside the organization. They walk through the configuration wizard for the proxy server, pointing out some common pitfalls. Then they confirm successful configuration using event viewer. They finish by testing connectivity from outside the organization.
episodes.title: Install SSO Proxy Server Part 2

topics.title: Implement and manage federated identities for single sign-on (SSO)

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike demonstrate several ways to monitor and troubleshoot Office 365 availability and usage. They look at several tools available through the admin portal of Office 365. They show the various reports available in Office 365. Then they look at some additional tools available from Microsoft to help troubleshoot Office 365 availability.
episodes.title: Monitoring Office365

topics.title: Monitor and troubleshoot Office 365 availability and usage
